casebody.data:
LIEBERMAN, Respondent, v. VERMILYE et al., Appellants. (City Court of New York, General Term. February 8, 1894.) Action by Ernest Lieberman against Oscar E. Vermilye and another.

Argued before EHRLICH, C. J., and VAN WYCK, J.

M. J. Stein, for appellants.' I. A. Englehard, for respondent. EHRLICH, C. J.

The papers presented a fair case, calling for the exercise of the discretion of the court below, which was not abused by directing: the defendants to furnish the bill of particulars, provided for by the order, which must be affirmed, with costs.
